thread.title: School bus carrying 30 pupils overturns - BBC News
thread.title_full: School bus carrying 30 pupils overturns - BBC News

title: School bus carrying 30 pupils overturns - BBC News
text:
School bus carrying 30 pupils overturns 9 February 2017 Image caption The bus landed on its side at Dowanfield Road near the school A bus carrying about 30 school children has overturned in North Lanarkshire. 
The incident happened outside Our Lady's High School in Cumbernauld shortly before 09:00. 
The single decker, which was coming from the Abronhill area, flipped onto its side at Dowanfield Road, next to the school. 
Emergency services attended and two children were taken to hospital as a precaution. The school said parents had been informed. 
Those involved in the crash have been taken to an assembly hall within the school for attention. 
In a statement, North Lanarkshire Council said: "A single decker bus overturned just before 9am this morning close to Our Lady's HS, Cumbernauld. 
"The bus was coming from the Abronhill area (Moss Road), with around 50 pupils on board. 
"At the moment there are no reports of serious injuries. However, two pupils have been taken to hospital as a precaution." 
Police Scotland said the crash happened at about 08:45 and involved one vehicle and 30 pupils, not 50 as initially reported. 
A spokesman said emergency crews remained at the scene and that an investigation into the cause of the crash was ongoing.
